author: Albert Einstein
quote_content: Imagination is more important than knowledge.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quote_content: All things are subject to interpretation; whichever interpretation prevails at a given time is a function of power and not truth.

author: Isabel Allende
quote_content: Write what should not be forgotten.

author: Maya Angelou
quote_content: You may not control all the events that happen to you, but you can decide not to be reduced by them.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quote_content: Art is the mediator of the inexpressible.

author: Gabriel García Márquez
quote_content: Age isn't how old you are but how old you feel.

author: Steve Jobs
quote_content: Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower.

author: Johann Sebastian Bach
quote_content: The aim and final end of all music should be none other than the glory of God and the refreshment of the soul.

author: Pablo Neruda
quote_content: You can cut all the flowers but you cannot keep spring from coming.

author: Martin Luther King Jr.
quote_content: Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.

author: Marie Curie
quote_content: Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less.

author: Hermann Hesse
quote_content: Words do not express thoughts very well. They always become a little different immediately after they are expressed, a little distorted, a little foolish.

author: Isaac Newton
quote_content: If I have seen further it is by standing on the shoulders of Giants.

author: Franz Kafka
quote_content: I write differently from what I speak, I speak differently from what I think, I think differently from the way I ought to think, and so it all proceeds into deepest darkness.

author: Gloria Anzaldúa
quote_content: To survive the Borderlands you must live sin fronteras be a crossroads.

author: Goethe
quote_content: Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Willing is not enough; we must do.

author: Octavio Paz
quote_content: A society, no matter how well-ordered, is only as healthy as its language.

author: Mark Twain
quote_content: The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why.

author: Immanuel Kant
quote_content: Act only according to that maxim whereby you can at the same time will that it should become a universal law.

author: Antonio Machado
quote_content: Traveler, there is no path, the path must be forged as you walk.

author: Rainer Maria Rilke
quote_content: For one human being to love another: that is perhaps the most difficult of our tasks; the ultimate, the last test and proof, the work for which all other work is but preparation.

author: Cervantes
quote_content: When life itself seems lunatic, who knows where madness lies?

author: Charles Darwin
quote_content: It is not the strongest of the species that survives, nor the most intelligent; it is the one most responsive to change.

author: Johann Gottfried Herder
quote_content: Without language, thought is a vague, uncharted nebula.

author: Pablo Picasso
quote_content: Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once we grow up.

author: Virginia Woolf
quote_content: Lock up your libraries if you like; but there is no gate, no lock, no bolt that you can set upon the freedom of my mind.

author: Hermann Hesse
quote_content: Words do not express thoughts very well. They always become a little different immediately after they are expressed, a little distorted, a little foolish.

author: Sor Juana Inez de la Cruz
quote_content: I don't study to know more, but to ignore less.

author: George Orwell
quote_content: Freedom is the right to tell people what they do not want to hear.

author: Rainer Maria Rilke
quote_content: I hold this to be the highest task for a bond between two people: that each protects the solitude of the other.

author: Miguel de Unamuno
quote_content: Faith which does not doubt is dead faith.

author: Voltaire
quote_content: I do not agree with what you have to say, but I'll defend to the death your right to say it.

author: Mariano José de Larra
quote_content: A journalist is a grumbler, a censurer, a giver of advice, a regent of sovereigns, a tutor of nations. Four hostile newspapers are more to be feared than a thousand bayonets.

author: Jane Austen
quote_content: A lady's imagination is very rapid; it jumps from admiration to love, from love to matrimony in a moment.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quote_content: Man sees in the world what he carries in his heart.

author: Octavio Paz
quote_content: Each of us is several, is many, is a profusion of selves. So that the self who disdains his surroundings is not the same as the self who suffers or takes joy in them.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote_content: There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed.

author: Friedrich Schiller
quote_content: Art is the daughter of freedom.

author: Gabriel García Márquez
quote_content: What matters in life is not what happens to you but what you remember and how you remember it.

author: Charlotte Brontë
quote_content: I am no bird; and no net ensnares me: I am a free human being with an independent will.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quote_content: Music is liquid architecture; Architecture is frozen music.

author: Albert Einstein
quote_content: Logic will get you from A to B. Imagination will take you everywhere.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quote_content: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.

author: Isabel Allende
quote_content: The most important things are the hardest to say because words diminish them.

author: Maya Angelou
quote_content: My mission in life is not merely to survive, but to thrive; and to do so with some passion, some compassion, some humor, and some style.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quote_content: He who possesses art and science has religion; he who does not possess them, needs religion.

author: Gabriel García Márquez
quote_content: No medicine cures what happiness cannot.

author: Steve Jobs
quote_content: Your work is going to fill a large part of your life, and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work.

author: Johann Sebastian Bach
quote_content: The greatest glory of a free-born people is to transmit that freedom to their children.

author: Pablo Neruda
quote_content: Love is so short, forgetting is so long.

author: Martin Luther King Jr.
quote_content: Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate; only love can do that.

author: Marie Curie
quote_content: Nothing in life is to be feared; it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less.

author: Hermann Hesse
quote_content: Some of us think holding on makes us strong, but sometimes it is letting go.

author: Isaac Newton
quote_content: If I have done the public any service, it is due to my patient thought.

author: Franz Kafka
quote_content: In man's struggle against the world, bet on the world.

author: Gloria Anzaldúa
quote_content: This is why the serpent that climbs out of the earth and flies into the sky is considered divine.

author: Goethe
quote_content: Man knows only what he can do.

author: Octavio Paz
quote_content: The word is born of the quest for meaning.

author: Mark Twain
quote_content: The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time.

author: Immanuel Kant
quote_content: Two things awe me most, the starry sky above me and the moral law within me.

author: Antonio Machado
quote_content: Traveler, your footprints are the only road, nothing else. Traveler, there is no road; you make your own path as you walk.

author: Rainer Maria Rilke
quote_content: The purpose of life is to be defeated by greater and greater things.

author: Cervantes
quote_content: When life itself seems lunatic, who knows where madness lies?

author: Charles Darwin
quote_content: A scientific man ought to have no wishes, no affections, - a mere heart of stone.

author: Johann Gottfried Herder
quote_content: Language is the archive of history.

author: Pablo Picasso
quote_content: Every artist dips his brush in his own soul, and paints his own nature into his pictures.

author: Virginia Woolf
quote_content: One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well.

author: Hermann Hesse
quote_content: Words do not express thoughts very well. They always become a little different immediately after they are expressed, a little distorted, a little foolish.

author: Sor Juana Inez de la Cruz
quote_content: One can perfectly well philosophize while cooking supper.

author: George Orwell
quote_content: In a time of deceit, telling the truth is a revolutionary act.

author: Rainer Maria Rilke
quote_content: Be patient toward all that is unsolved in your heart and try to love the questions themselves.

author: Miguel de Unamuno
quote_content: A fanatic is one who can't change his mind and won't change the subject.

author: Voltaire
quote_content: Judge a man by his questions rather than by his answers.

author: Mariano José de Larra
quote_content: Man is the only animal that laughs and weeps; for he is the only animal that is struck with the difference between what things are, and what they ought to be.

author: Jane Austen
quote_content: Friendship is certainly the finest balm for the pangs of disappointed love.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quote_content: In nature we never see anything isolated, but everything in connection with something else which is before it, beside it, under it and over it.

author: Octavio Paz
quote_content: Every vision is a joke until the first man accomplishes it; once realized, it becomes commonplace.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote_content: The first draft of anything is shit.

author: Friedrich Schiller
quote_content: Grace is the beauty of form under the influence of freedom.

author: Gabriel García Márquez
quote_content: It's enough for me to be sure that you and I exist at this moment.

author: Charlotte Brontë
quote_content: I avoid looking forward or backward, and try to keep looking upward.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quote_content: The greatest happiness you can have is knowing that you do not necessarily require happiness.

author: Albert Einstein
quote_content: The only source of knowledge is experience.
